meanings.definition: A comprehensive description and explanation of an idea or theory.
meanings.sent1: The teacher's exposition on photosynthesis was very informative.
meanings.sent2: The science museum had an interesting exposition on space exploration.
meanings.sent3: During the lecture, the professor's exposition on unicorns made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her exposition on the benefits of meditation was like a beacon of light in the darkness.
meanings.sent5: The book's exposition on ancient civilizations was so vivid, it felt like traveling back in time.

meanings.sent1: The art gallery hosted an impressive exposition of local artists' work.
meanings.sent2: The annual book fair is a popular exposition for book lovers.
meanings.sent3: The circus's exposition of acrobatic stunts amazed the audience.
meanings.sent4: The fashion show was an exposition of the latest trends in clothing.
meanings.sent5: The zoo's animal exposition was a hit with families visiting the park.

meanings.definition: The act of presenting or explaining something in a detailed manner.
meanings.sent1: His exposition of the new project plan was clear and easy to understand.
meanings.sent2: The student's exposition of the historical event was well-received by the class.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's exposition of everyday life situations had the audience in stitches.
meanings.sent4: The chef's exposition of the recipe was like a step-by-step guide to cooking.
meanings.sent5: The tour guide's exposition of the museum artifacts brought history to life for the visitors.
